main event: A radar operator and a Lt. Col. in the USAF separately observed a large, brilliant white light object in the sky over Hartford, Connecticut on July 10, 1957.
interesting points: The radar operator initially spotted the object on the radar scope, and then visually confirmed it through binoculars.
The object was described as being uneven in sound, about 1.0 times the diameter of the full moon, and moving erratically.
Lt. Col. Woolley observed the object for 25-30 seconds, describing it as a brilliant white light much larger than 4 stars, moving steadily from west to east.
There were multiple reports of similar sightings in the New England region, including from New Haven, Boston, and an AP correspondent.
No other aircraft or light sources were identified in the area at the time of the sightings.
witnesses: a radar operator and Lt. Col. Frank P. Woolley Jr. of the USAF
